  • Mesh Objects

Mesh Objects#

Module containing classes and methods for mesh sizing creation, reading, writing and general manipulation.

Classes:

MSH_Object(name, SF_class)

Main class for scope sizing objects.

BOI(name, SF_class)

Mesh object subclass describing Body Of Influence objects.

Vehicle(name, SF_class)

Class defining vehicle objects.

Functions:

ReadObjectList(SF_File_Path)

Function responsible for reading a .txt file with size field data and writing these data into a responsible mesh objects Returns a list of all mesh objects

ReadJsonObjList(SF_File_Path)

Read data from .json list and initialise them as Mesh Objects

MakeBoundaryLayerDict(Obj_list, Part_list, ...)

Obsolete

MakeBoundaryLayerDict2(Obj_list, Part_list, ...)

Assigns correct prism settings to individual parts so no prism settings share the same part (due to the mesh setting inheritance)

MakePrismWildcard(Self, Obj_list)

WriteObjToFile(Obj_list, FilePath)

Only for legacy scope files.

WriteScopeToJson(Obj_list, file_path)

Writes given mesh object settings list into a provided .json file
class MeshObjects.MSH_Object(name, SF_class)#

Bases: object

Main class for scope sizing objects. All objects used for meshing are MSH_Object MSH_Object contains functions for finding parents of objects and parts belonging to given object

Attributes:

_registry

MSH_ID

Methods:

__init__(name, SF_class)

_findID()

Function iterates through all active Meshing Objects and finds smallest avaiable ID

_findParents(Obj_list)

Method for finding object parents based on their immediate parent !!!WARNING!!! - this method is obsolete as it was used for manually set Scope Sizing file.

_findParentsNew()

Newer method for finding parents where whole parent tree is already provided from Scope Sizing file as it is assumed that the file is automatically generated from user GUI and therefore can store more information without being too anoying for user to manipulate with

_findParts(Obj_list, Part_list)

Method for finding all parts containing the name
_registry = []#
__init__(name, SF_class)#
MSH_ID = 0#
_findID()#

Function iterates through all active Meshing Objects and finds smallest avaiable ID

Returns:

int

_findParents(Obj_list)#

Method for finding object parents based on their immediate parent !!!WARNING!!! - this method is obsolete as it was used for manually set Scope Sizing file. This method can cope badly with same named Size Field objects as is correct parrent

_findParentsNew()#

Newer method for finding parents where whole parent tree is already provided from Scope Sizing file as it is assumed that the file is automatically generated from user GUI and therefore can store more information without being too anoying for user to manipulate with

This function simply reads string af all object parents and creates a list of parents from that string.

Returns:

list[string]

_findParts(Obj_list, Part_list)#

Method for finding all parts containing the name

Returns:

list[MSH_Object]

class MeshObjects.BOI(name, SF_class)#

Bases: MSH_Object

Mesh object subclass describing Body Of Influence objects. This class contains information abou scoped sizing for BOIs

Attributes:

_BOIregistry

Methods:

__init__(name, SF_class)

_ValueRead(LineList, LinePointer)

Iterates through all object attributes (except methods) and assigns values from the object text file to the empty values.

_ValueReadJson(Boi_dir)

Reads values from a .json file
_BOIregistry = []#
__init__(name, SF_class)#
_ValueRead(LineList, LinePointer)#

Iterates through all object attributes (except methods) and assigns values from the object text file to the empty values. Function takes as input whole list of object properties (LineList) and pointer (int) to the line placement of beggining of current object

_ValueReadJson(Boi_dir)#

Reads values from a .json file

class MeshObjects.Vehicle(name, SF_class)#

Bases: MSH_Object

Class defining vehicle objects. Those are objects that are directly parts of the vehicle (chassis, aero, suspension etc.). A such this class stores their atributes containing info about these parts size fields and prisms as well as methods for their initialisation.

Attributes:

_VEHregistry

Methods:

__init__(name, SF_class)

_ValueRead(LineList, LinePointer)

Iterates through all object attributes (except methods) and assigns values from the object text file to the empty values.

_ValueReadJson(Vehicle_dir)

Reads values from a .json file
_VEHregistry = []#
__init__(name, SF_class)#
_ValueRead(LineList, LinePointer)#

Iterates through all object attributes (except methods) and assigns values from the object text file to the empty values. Function takes as input whole list of object properties (LineList) and pointer (int) to the line placement of beggining of current object

_ValueReadJson(Vehicle_dir)#

Reads values from a .json file

MeshObjects.ReadObjectList(SF_File_Path)#

Function responsible for reading a .txt file with size field data and writing these data into a responsible mesh objects Returns a list of all mesh objects

MeshObjects.ReadJsonObjList(SF_File_Path)#

Read data from .json list and initialise them as Mesh Objects

Returns:

dict[list[MSH_Objects]]

MeshObjects.MakeBoundaryLayerDict(Obj_list, Part_list, Zone_list)#

Obsolete

MeshObjects.MakeBoundaryLayerDict2(Obj_list, Part_list, Zone_list)#

Assigns correct prism settings to individual parts so no prism settings share the same part (due to the mesh setting inheritance)

Returns:

dict

MeshObjects.MakePrismWildcard(Self, Obj_list)#
MeshObjects.WriteObjToFile(Obj_list, FilePath)#

Only for legacy scope files. Surpassed by WriteScopeToJson() function

MeshObjects.WriteScopeToJson(Obj_list, file_path)#

Writes given mesh object settings list into a provided .json file
